p: The clinical outcomes of FluA-p are worse than FluB-p, highlighting the importance of influenza virus strain testing in the management of severe influenza. As influenza A virus infection is a predictor for poor outcomes in patients with influenza-related pneumonia, regardless of their ages and chronic underlying conditions, the clinicians should pay more attention to patients with FluA-p. Also, it suggests the priority of vaccination covered influenza virus type A strains in certain populations is rational.
